intro: Clidemia pennipilis, commonly known as the white mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and showy, white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Clidemia pennipilis is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in humid conditions.
